metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3307 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The phar_parse_metadata function in ext/phar/phar.c in PHP before 5.4.40,5.5.x before 5.5.24, and 5.6.x before 5.6.8 allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (heap metadata corruption) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via a crafted tar archive.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3307` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-common - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-curl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-enchant - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9

php5-gd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9

php5-intl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-ldap - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9

php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-pgsql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-pspell - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-readline - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-recode - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-snmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-sqlite - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-sybase - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-tidy - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9

php5-xsl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9').
